trans-unit.source: Unplugged: Battleship
trans-unit.target: アンプラグド： Battleship

trans-unit.source: The game Battleship is perhaps the most fun a student can have practicing using a coordinate grid.
trans-unit.target: The game Battleship is perhaps the most fun 生徒 can have practicing using a coordinate grid.

trans-unit.source: The original Battleship game is a 10x10 grid with numbers on one axis and letters on the other.
trans-unit.target: The original Battleship game is a 10x10 grid with numbers on one axis and letters on the other.

trans-unit.source: To help us practice using the correct coordinates for the grid of micro:bit LEDs, let the students play a smaller 5x5 version of Battleship using x and y coordinates instead of letters and numbers.
trans-unit.target: To help us practice using the correct coordinates for the grid of micro:bit LEDs, let 生徒たち play a smaller 5x5 version of Battleship using x and y coordinates instead of letters and numbers.

trans-unit.source: Have students make their own sets of 5x5 grids to reinforce the layout of the micro:bit grid.
trans-unit.target: Have students make their own sets of 5x5 grids to reinforce the layout of the micro:bit grid.

trans-unit.source: Each student should make two grids.
trans-unit.target: Each student should make two grids.

trans-unit.source: One grid is for placing their own ships and keeping track of their opponent’s hits and misses and the other grid is for keeping track of their own hits and misses while trying to determine the location of their opponent’s ships.
trans-unit.target: One grid is for placing their own ships and keeping track of their opponent’s hits and misses and the other grid is for keeping track of their own hits and misses while trying to determine the location of their opponent’s ships.

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/coordinates/player-grid.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/coordinates/player-grid.png

trans-unit.source: Player Grid Example
trans-unit.target: Player Grid Example

trans-unit.source: Player’s grid: Mark where your ships are and keep track of your opponent’s hits and misses.
trans-unit.target: Player’s grid: Mark where your ships are and keep track of your opponent’s hits and misses.

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/coordinates/opponent-grid.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/coordinates/opponent-grid.png

trans-unit.source: Opponent Grid Example
trans-unit.target: Opponent Grid Example

trans-unit.source: Opponent’s grid: Keep track of your hits and misses while trying to locate your opponent’s ships.
trans-unit.target: Opponent’s grid: Keep track of your hits and misses while trying to locate your opponent’s ships.

trans-unit.source: Then pair the students to play against a partner.
trans-unit.target: Then pair 生徒たち to play against a partner.

trans-unit.source: Each student's ships are hidden somewhere on their 5x5 grid.
trans-unit.target: Each student's ships are hidden somewhere on their 5x5 grid.

trans-unit.source: Students should be taking turns calling their shots using x and y coordinates, in the proper order.
trans-unit.target: Students should be taking turns calling their shots using x and y coordinates, in the proper order.

trans-unit.source: Their opponent will use those coordinates to plot the location of their shots.
trans-unit.target: Their opponent will use those coordinates to plot the location of their shots.

trans-unit.source: If a hit is recorded on a ship, then you say, "Hit".
trans-unit.target: If a hit is recorded on a ship, then you say, "Hit".

trans-unit.source: If the shot misses, you say, "Miss".
trans-unit.target: If the shot misses, you say, "Miss".

trans-unit.source: If the entire length of a ship is hit, it is sunk and removed from play.
trans-unit.target: If the entire length of a ship is hit, it is sunk and removed from play.

trans-unit.source: Tradition dictates that the player announces, "You sank my battleship!"
trans-unit.target: Tradition dictates that the player announces, "You sank my battleship!"

trans-unit.source: Since their grid is only one quarter the size of the original Battleship grid, students can use fewer and smaller ships. For example, they could play with 3 ships, one each of size 3, 2, and 1.
trans-unit.target: Since their grid is only one quarter the size of the original Battleship grid, students can use fewer and smaller ships. 例えば、 they could play with 3 ships, one each of size 3, 2, and 1.

trans-unit.source: The game can be played with just paper and pencils or you could use small tokens and markers, like coins, buttons, or paper clips to represent the ships.
trans-unit.target: The game can be played with just paper and pencils or you could use small tokens and markers, like coins, buttons, or paper clips to represent the ships.

trans-unit.source: Notes:
trans-unit.target: 追加情報：

trans-unit.source: Place students’ grids in sheet protectors or laminate them so they can be used again and again with white board (dry erase) markers.
trans-unit.target: Place students’ grids in sheet protectors or laminate them so they can be used again and again with white board (dry erase) markers.

trans-unit.source: The official rules of Battleship are easily found on the internet. Modify them as needed for your particular class.
trans-unit.target: The official rules of Battleship are easily found on the internet. Modify them as needed for your particular class.
